content: Oh that sounds familiar! But unfortunately I don't remember anything beyond what you already said.
@Owen Lynch what construction are you trying to generalize here?

Given a lax symmetric monoidal functor into Cat\mathsf{Cat}Cat, the monoidal Grothendieck construction gives a symmetric monoidal category, and you can take the underlying operad of that. But that's still just a 1-operad. The maps in the fibers get incorporated into the operations.
